You can use the corresponding function t: You can use the corresponding function through the following instructions.
s config add help:
You can add an account.

    Example:
        $ s config add
        $ s config add -p alibaba
        $ s config add -p alibaba --AccessKeyID ****** --AccessKeySecret ****** --AccountID ******
        $ s config add -p huawei --AccessKey ****** --SecretKey ******

    Configuration parameters for cloud vendors:
        alibaba: AccountID, AccessKeyID, AccessKeySecret
        aws: AccessKeyID, SecretAccessKey
        azure: KeyVaultName, TenantID, ClentID, ClientSecret
        baidu: AccessKeyID, SecretAccessKey
        huawei: AccessKey, SecretKey
        google: PrivateKeyData
        tencent: AccountID, SecretID, SecretKey
s config delete help:
You can delete an account.

     Example:
        $ s config delete -p alibaba -a demo
s config get help:
You can get accounts.
 
     Example:
        $ s config get -l
        $ s config get -p alibaba -a demo
s config update help:
You can update an account.
 
     Example:
        $ s config update -p alibaba -a demo
        $ s config update -p alibaba -a demo --AccountID ************
